activities: PayFactors stores user information for the purposes of access to it's enterprise compensation platform.  PayFactors may store customer’s names, addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses and any information that can be linked to an individual.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: PayFactors stores user information for the purposes of access to it's enterprise compensation platform.
privacyprograms: self-regulatory privacy program that adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles
recoursemech: Consumers are encouraged to raise any complaints they may have with PayFactors directly before proceeding to independent recourse mechanisms.  The independent recourse mechanism is though the EU and/or Swiss data protection authorities.
